title: 6 bans aren't enough
body:
Riot, I love the whole idea with giving 1 ban to a player instead of all bans to one player. However, 6 bans aren't enough. I end up done with banning phase unsatisfied because I know there will still be someone who is really strong that is super annoying to play against. Why didn't you give 1 ban to each player? 10 bans in total. I mean, in the old champion select, it looked like there was room for two more champion icons to be in the banned area. Almost like you intended to add more bans.

Edit: I hadn't thought of this until you guys brought it up. Yes, this would make it so you would need to have 20 champions to play draft. This is because there is the super super super rare possiblity that of the 10 bans, they're all champions that you own or are on free week, then all the rest of the champions picked are the only ones that you have and you're last pick. If you have any less than 20 champions and this occurs, you're screwed. Also, this game has 120+ champions. 6 bans aren't enough.

Edit: To those who are saying that 6 bans are plenty, here are what the bans for my games normally look like.
My Team:               |  Enemy Team:
Dr. Mundo              |  Garen      
Darius                     |   Gangplank
Blitzcrank                |   Poppy

There are still more champions that are super strong right at the moment and can easily carry games. I'd love to be able to have 2 more bans for my team so we could ban things like Nidalee and Tahm Kench. Then the other team has 2 more bans as well.

There is something called counter pick. So far, The champs I cant counter are jax(even if he loses early game, he can get fed very easily in mid/late game) voli(his passive is too insane) ,brand (too much aoe burst damage and a stun included) and Illaoi ( the tentacles do too mucb damage). In my opinion if the 10 banned champions just so happen to be the only 10 champions that an individual knows how to play then they need to start learning how to play more than just the flavor of the month champions, since those are the ones that get banned. 

I fully support more bans because with the way champions are being released/reworked 6 bans just isn't enough to avoid all the bs coming down the pipe.

A lot of the time it's a matter of not just banning what is too strong, but what is strong against you.  Smart bans aren't just about what is OP, but knowing what WON'T be OP against your team.  Say for example you have strong counter to Mundo who can buly him out of lane. Counter picking meta champs is just as effective as banning them. Remember when Rammus' winrate skyrockted when ADCs were in every lane?

Also, it's absolutely possible to make sub optimal bans, such as poppy who is sitting at a pretty medium power level but doesn't have a lot of massively oppressive match ups.  She is new though, and so some who don't get her kit ban her.

so in other words you just want to be able to ban everyone's hard counters and sit back and Have an easy game... naw man. Six Bans are more than  enough. If I was developing I wouldnt even do that many. Maybe 2 bans for each team... if you're lucky

I just don't like that bans are randomly given to players. For me, everyone should get one ban. It just isn't fair to be playing mid, having 1st or second pick after getting no bans, and then getting hard countered by the other team. By making it one ban per player, you allow for the hard counters to get removed (not just the op fotm champs). Personally, I don't have a problem with a few of the champs that are commonly banned, but as a diana main I look to ban lux, lb, or zed.
I feel like they should really just give a ban to everyone... Like really. They can ban the champ they struggle the most against.
The way I see it is that if there are that many OP champions and you can only ban 6 of them, each team can still pick the left over broken champs, making it reasonably balanced in the end

You could ban out marksmen and supports with that many bans. Or assassins, only a handful of them are ever viable (until people forget they were nerfed and then get them nerfed again).

Or conversely, why do you have a problem with Darius but not Renekton? With Garen but not with Malphite? With GP but not with Jax/Vlad? With Blitz but not with Naut/Thresh/Leo? With Poppy but not with Cho'Gath (both have unreliable skill shots galore)? Mundo's a bitch.

You're lucky to get any bans. Bans are not necessary. Certain champions are meant to snowball easy when only given a few kills. When facing those snowball champions, you need to be careful and not die to them. A lot of people don't realize why they die and aren't as careful or aware of what they're doing that gets them killed. The bans are a mercy from Riot because you can't always trust your team to not let those certain champions snowball.

Expecting the ability to ban all other strong champions than the one you want to play is an ignorant expectation.
